# Getting started

Install the dependencies:

npm install @vue-accounts/core

Add the store plugin to use the components with your Vuex account store

import Vuex from 'vuex';
import { AccountStorePlugin } from '@vue-accounts/core';

Vue.use(Vuex);

const store = new Vue.Store({});

Vue.use(AccountStorePlugin, { store }); // Init the plugin with the Vuex store

The above store plugin will expose global account methods that you can call from anywhere in your app.

# Adding Components

You can use component libraries to provide the forms and other account components or build your own components!

npm install @vue-accounts/bare

The above example provides a couple of forms without any styling that fit gracefully on the global account methods. You can now add for example a fully functional login form:

<template>
  <login-form />
</template>

<script>
  import { LoginForm } from '@vue-accounts/bare';

  export default {
    components: {
      LoginForm,
    },
  };
</script>

# Component Libraries:

Below is a list of libraries that provide pre-made components that work gracefully with Vue Accounts:

  • @vue-accounts/bare: (Coming soon) Pre-made account components without any styling applied
  • @vue-accounts/bootstrap: (Coming soon) Pre-made Bootstrap account components
  • @vue-accounts/vuetify: Pre-made Vuetify account components

# Adding a store module

The though the store plugin provides the global methods, the methods don't do anything 'yet'. for this to work you either download an existing module or you create your own.

Here's an example using the Meteor accounts system:

npm install @vue-accounts/meteor

Meteor's store uses a store in combination with the module so you need to add them both:

import AccountStore, { AccountStorePlugin } from '@vue-accounts/meteor';

export default new Vuex.Store({
  plugins: [AccountStorePlugin],
  modules: {
    account: AccountStore,
  },
});

# Pre-made Store Modules

  • @vue-accounts/meteor Connects Meteor's account system to the Vue Accounts.
